meanings.definition: Resembling an amoeba in shape or movement.
meanings.sent1: The cell moved in an amoeboid manner, stretching and contracting as it traveled.
meanings.sent2: The artist created an amoeboid sculpture that seemed to flow and change before your eyes.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they watched the jelly wiggle in an amoeboid dance.
meanings.sent4: The fog crept through the valley in an amoeboid fashion, enveloping everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The lava flowed down the volcano's slopes in an amoeboid pattern, leaving a trail of destruction behind.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an amoeba.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the amoeboid behavior of the single-celled organism.
meanings.sent2: The textbook explained the amoeboid structure of the microscopic creature.
meanings.sent3: The petri dish contained an amoeboid blob that seemed to pulsate with life.
meanings.sent4: The spaceship's design was inspired by the sleek, amoeboid shape of the alien spacecraft.
meanings.sent5: The jellyfish moved through the water with an elegant, amoeboid grace.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a changing shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The clouds in the sky took on an amoeboid appearance, constantly shifting and morphing.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting captured the essence of an amoeboid world where nothing stayed the same.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter spread out in an amoeboid manner, filling every corner of the pan.
meanings.sent4: The shadows cast by the trees on the ground had an almost amoeboid quality, changing with the slightest breeze.
meanings.sent5: The dance troupe moved in perfect sync, their bodies flowing in an amoeboid rhythm.
